Articles.Content: I've been building rovers quite a bit lately, and have been coming up with unstable yet very awesome designs, the main reason they're unstable is because they keep tilting when I hit the WASD keys to move, putting it in docking mode doesn't help, it still tilts with the WASD keys. I need help to change these keys to the arrow keys (I don't use them for the view thing) but ONLY when I'm in docking mode, when I'm in staging mode I need the WASD keys to still function as roll/tilt/yaw. Any suggestions? Thanks in advance!
Try binding the wheel control keys to IJKL instead of WASD. Or just turn off your reaction wheels and RCS.

Try binding the wheel control keys to IJKL instead of WASD. Or just turn off your reaction wheels and RCS.

Would that only happen in docking mode? I'll go give it a shot. Thanks for the quick reply!
As far as I can tell, the usual advice is to just go into docking mode. I'm not sure if they've changed it in 1.0, however...
You can just click on your probe core/SAS and toggle the reaction wheels off.
